title: Evidence Generation Data Scientist or Sr Associate, Data Scientist / Epidemiologist
text: To plan and execute Observational Research using Real World Data to answer key question regarding our therapeutic areas.    Generate Scientific Evidence from internal and external databases, both private and public.    To contribute Observational Research strategies to achieve ACI Evidence Generation goals cross-functionally.    Map, identify and access the best RWD (Real World Data) sources to enable RWE (Real World Evidence) tactical plan.    Execute and manage descriptive epidemiologic studies to characterize the incidence/prevalence and distribution of diseases, the natural history and clinical burden of disease, cost and utilization patterns, and the safety and effectiveness of therapies.    Execute and manage research projects involving the analysis of multiple types of data including medical claims, EMR and prospective observational cohort studies.    Ensure compliance to all internal and external rules regarding access to data, publication and development of observational research.    Liaising with internal stakeholders concerning data acquisitions, and patient registry development/partnerships, etc. usability and re-usability of data.    Conduct literature reviews and preparing research reports for scientific manuscripts.    Stay abreast of the latest developments in the field of observational research and drug development.    Promote awareness, understanding and use of observational research methods.    Confirming selection and appropriate use of suitable database study designs for studies.    Partnering with hospitals and clinics to use external information as a way to solve clinical and scientific questions.    Partnering with the Access Team to ensure maximum impact of activities to the patient.    Design and implement Real World Data (RWD) studies to generate Real World Evidence (RWE).    Providing strategic direction to address complex health outcomes challenges.    Defining and shaping research with partners and/or vendors to produce high quality research results.    Cooperate with IT departments to correct and efficient health care data warehousing.    Keep updated with current trends in data science applied to health outcomes evaluation.    Background in medical informatics, epidemiology and/or statistics    3+ years’ experience with data science, focus in health care data    Medical / Scientific research experience    Experience in handling large datasets    Experience in the design, execution and analysis of observation research studies within Pharmaceutical and/or Public Health settings    Experience in observational research project planning and management    Experience working in multi-disciplinary teams    Strong knowledge of the scientific method and observational research methods    Good statistical methods knowledge    Knowledge on public health care databases and how to handle them    Data science tools: R, STATA, SPSS or Python    Demonstrates strong knowledge in SQL, data handling, warehousing and analysis    Demonstrates strong project management and presentation skills    Good knowledge of clinical research, drug safety, legal and compliance environment    Willingness to continuously expand medical, scientific, market and industry knowledge

title: Data Scientist
text: Use case identification:   Expand on the currently identified use cases by partnering with the existing model development groups and the business partners and identify other types of models/applications where ML and AI can add value. This will cover areas such as credit risk, economic capital, AML and market risk.   Structure above identified use cases, define operating model, manage delivery and provide   Data collection and manipulation   Collect data for model development purposes by identifying new candidate variables and predictive variables.   Analyze and summarize data to identify outliers and assess data quality.   Perform data imputation using advanced statistical techniques (multiple imputation, machine learning estimations).   Transform and prepare the data for developing AI models.   Predictive models development   Fully understand the existing version of the models where applicable, their limitations and all the underlying assumptions made.   Use the prepared data to build machine learning predictive models using advanced regression techniques such as random forests, neural networks, boosted trees, deep learning, logistic regressions, NLP etc…   Rank and compare the candidate models to select the best fitting models.   Use statistical tests to ensure the stability and robustness of the candidate models.   Identify new opportunities to apply machine learning in the current model development process.   Reasonableness assessment   Ensure that the models developed make business and intuitive sense by participating in sessions with the model owners, lines of businesses and including their feedback in the model.   Design a process to explain the output of the models on a consistent basis to understand why the models are producing these decisions.   Documentation   Document the process along the way by capturing the details around all assumptions made.   Keep record and detailed notes about the thought process. The models developed will serve as a proof of concept for future ML & AI models in credit risk.   Master or PhD candidate in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related quantitative field.   5-10 years of experience in AML, risk management and machine learning and AI techniques   Familiarity with risk management processes and methodologies, ideally AML   Familiarity with Bank credit instruments and product structures   Familiarity with systems management and data architecture principles   Experience with statistical model development and data mining   Proven experience using SAS, R or Python to build machine learning models   Strong theoretical knowledge of machine learning techniques and advanced regression methods and data imputation techniques   Well-developed relationship management skills.   Excellent influencing and negotiation skills   Strong problem solving skills and capacity to turnaround analysis in short period of time   Comfortable in a challenging environment with tight timelines   Excellent written and verbal communication skills   Capacity to cope with a high degree of ambiguity and change   Ability to work both independently and as part of cross-functional teams   Prior industry experience or academic projects with machine learning and advanced programming is preferred.   High-level of competency with MS Office suite of tools

title: Data Scientist II
text: Interpret Model Risk Management Model Development Reporting    Understand the Inputs/features that were used to build models and tools, with plain language explanations and impact of each input    Preliminary assessment of Risk (using Compliance Framework Risk Dimensions)    Solid understanding of bias/fairness testing methodology/approach select for the model/tool by the business and determine if viable in concert with Model Risk Management .  Validation of approach used to test for bias is critical given the numerous types of bias testing that exist, it is difficult for a non-data scientist to opine on appropriateness of the method(s) used.  Work with business and MRM as required to propose required modifications to the methodology    Guide business in the development of FAIR Assessment Report (bias and fairness)  Ensure completeness of documentation  Assess results of Bias and fairness testing  Determine whether there is any statistically significant disparate/discriminatory impact of the model  Determine next steps and controls including conditions    Ongoing/period monitoring plan and documentation requirements  Possibility of re-performing bias/fairness testing on a sample basis (risk based)  With a data scientist on board a consistent determination of reasonable frequency for monitoring of model output for changes in bias/fairness from the initial assessment. This is possible due to a solid understanding of the technical variations of modelling in conjunction with the use case (context).  Better opine on what is a reasonable amount of deviation in disparate outcomes and resulting need for Compliance engagement or not    Advise and validate  capabilities required to perform new Compliance role:  advisory and analytical testing capabilities    Advise on specific competencies required to  build advisory capabilities    Support discussing  options to build analytical testing capabilities    Assist in development of playbook and guidelines to assess preliminary risks and Compliance and Legal model lifecycle requirements (1B guidance)    Assist in development of playbook and guidelines for Compliance Officers    Support Training and deliverables associated with enhancing advisory capabilities and require specific skills and oversight capabilities    Support Development of Compliance Monitoring and Testing capabilities    Support role out activities and ongoing engagement of training and awareness activities associated with 1B's, Data Analytics community and Compliance Units   Provide thought leadership and/or industry knowledge for own area of expertise   Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation, and teamwork; title: Data Scientist
text: Designs and executes innovative and robust data solutions in collaboration with internal stakeholders to support team objectives. title: Data Scientist
text: High performance and ambition.  We have a seasoned leadership team, a self-sustaining business, and a clear path on how to keep accelerating. We are looking for talented people to join us on the next phase of our growth.    Innovation.  We have unlocked the power of data hidden behind bank walls for 65 years by giving customers a little extra for making everyday purchases. Our focus is on creating value through personalization, AI, machine learning, and big data. We are thinking and executing bold and ambitious goals.    Trust and professionalism.  We have a common goal and everyone pulls their weight and jumps in where they are needed. Trust, respect for each other, and good balance is critical to the core of our company and won't be comprised.    Intellectual stimulation and impact.  We are one of the few companies doing what we do with data-driven insights. It's exciting to be the first in a role, to work directly with co-founders, and to learn from experts in their field. This is your chance to research, apply, and test new data science, active learning, and ML strategies. You will develop algorithms that support product modelling and extract behavioural insights from our massive data set; adding value to our B2B and B2C customer bases.    A challenge culture.  You want to be part of a team where your suggestions are expected, challenged, and applied. You want to be part of the conversation; a place where you can figuratively raise your voice and literally go grab lunch together. You will collaborate closely with technical and non-technical team members in an Agile environment; ensuring the insights you derive are aligned with business goals and objectives.    Professional satisfaction.  You want to take an entrepreneurial approach, analyzing information, solving problems, building relationships and having fun doing it all. You have the grit needed to venture into uncharted territory; to build out our data science and automation capabilities. You want to grow your career with us, and you are eager to step up and make this happen.    The education. Ideally, you have a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, data science, analytics, or a related field or have the equivalent practical experience.    Technical expertise. You have 3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist and are skilled with TensorFlow, Keras, scikit-learn, NumPy, pandas, and Matplotlib. You are knowledgeable about information retrieval and search engines and have experience with Solr and Lucene. You are familiar with NLP toolkits (Spacy, NLTK), distributed computing platforms (Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Pig, Spark), and databases such as SQL/NoSQL.    Communication and collaboration skills. You thrive in collaborative, Agile environments and enjoy working cross-functionally. You're a hands-on, pitch-in-wherever needed person who isn't afraid to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. You share knowledge, voice your opinion, and listen to the ideas of others.    The drive. You want to build a great product and are ready to put in the work to do so. You are committed to delivering work that's high-quality and on schedule.    Balance.  We're at a stage of high growth and we're all hands on deck. With remote working and flexible hours, we trust our teams to get the job done without sacrificing critical personal time.    There is a lot of change in the air.  We are still building teams, processes, and culture. If you are comfortable with ambiguity and adapting, then Paymi is a rewarding place to grow and make your mark.    There's no hierarchy.  We're moving from start-up to scale-up. We'll seize moments to create new opportunities for our people based on merit and doing the right thing.

Keeps informed of current practices and research in statistical and machine learning modelling techniques and risk management by reading academic literature, attending academic and practitioner workshops and conferences.    Provides technical advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of the model validation framework, and resolution of model risk issues.    Develops and maintains in-depth knowledge of business and related model validation/risk management requirements and regulatory guidelines    Builds effective relationships with internal/external partners.    Ensures that business units understand that the model submission process involves preparing adequate model documentation to enable an appropriate model review    Participate in ad-hoc projects    Implement measurement & documentation framework against all project work    Generate insights in such a way that the businesses can clearly understand the quantifiable value. Turn statistical and computational analysis into user-friendly graphs, charts, and animation. Enable those who aren’t professional data analysts to effectively interpret data. In-depth knowledge & experience with risk policy frameworks; quality control / testing frameworks. title: Machine Learning Scientist
text: Python    PyTorch    Scikit-Learn    Docker    AWS (EC2, ECS, DynamoDB)    Research. You will spend 30% of your time researching the latest trends and breakthroughs in NLP, information extraction, and graph neural networks. Whether you find this information on Reddit, StackExchange, HackerNews, or in academic journals is up to you, but you'll be expected to share key takeaways with your team.    Develop. In this role, you'll hit the ground running creating production-level code for internal teams as well as our core AI capability within your first month. You'll work closely with the Data Science Lead and Machine Learning Scientists to create new ML algorithms and models, to execute on our product roadmap, and will push the envelope forward in InsureTech.    Collaborate. You will work with our Research and Engineering teams to iterate, develop and mature best in market product solutions.    The education. Ideally, you hold a master's degree or Ph.D. in machine learning, computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, or a related analytical field. We do, however, recognize that not everyone gains their skills this way. If you have a bachelor's degree in software engineering or computer science and the technical work experience to match, we'd still like to see your application.    The experience. You have 2+ years of experience developing production-level code, preferably in a machine learning or SaaS software environment. You have a strong understanding of graph neural networks, deep learning, and information extraction.    The technical skillset. You have a deep knowledge of PyTorch or similar frameworks such as Keras and TensorFlow. You've successfully applied these technologies in the past and are eager to learn new ways to leverage these frameworks.    The intellectual curiosity. You're a solutions-oriented individual who wants to dig deep into and apply the latest research to solve real business problems. You are known for keeping on top of best practices and industry breakthroughs; you are eager to share your expertise with our team.

title: Research Fellow
text: Quantifying and modeling tumour evolution and statistical modeling of outcome following treatment. title: Scientist, Assay Development
text: Design and execute in vitro experiments to assess and develop novel assays, techniques and technologies to characterize cell therapy manufacturing processes. This position requires hands-on laboratory work as well as supervision of research associates and technicians.   Present scientific data to colleagues in group meetings, prepare and present internal and external presentations (presentations, posters, publications) as required.   Perform additional duties to support the safe and efficient operation of the laboratory, and other duties as assigned. out and maintaining and an internal web application to index and display reports and research generated by the other data teams    Working with Data Engineering on extending functionality of the Data Environment based on requirements from the rest of the team    Building and/or deploying internal tools to solve problems or improve processes for the other data teams  These can be anything from custom-build CLI tools, web-apps, purchased software products, or AWS services as appropriate, automating process through a pipeline  Automate processes for analytics  Research and deploy on strategies for improving the efficiency of analytic processes    Operationalize data product for self-serve by the business units   Working with your team to turn business requirements into possible solutions    Ensuring stakeholders understand the trade-offs of the various implementation options and getting buy-in for one    Coordinating external dependencies and requirements for a given implementation (security, DBA, ops, legal, project managers, change management)    Removing blockers for your team, especially around process and externals    Ensuring that work is being done in a sustainable/maintainable manner to minimize technical debt    Identifying problems that could be solved and technical debt that should be addressed ahead of net-new work    Encouraging software dev best practices    Working with the CDO to prioritize tasks and projects    Making life easier for those around you   You have 2+ years working in software development, ideally working on live products with complex upstream and downstream dependencies or 2+ years working in data science/data engineering teams that involved deliverables to external parties  This experience should include working closely with engineering teams to build product features based on your work    You have leadership experience, either a team you've led or managed, or on a project or system you've taken ownership of    You have professional experience using python in at least two of following categories:  building (and/or maintaining) web-services or a web application with external consumers/customers  writing production-quality ETLs with upstream and downstream dependencies  delivering an end-to-end analysis/predictive modelling task including data prep and presenting/deploying the results  building internal tooling/pipelines for technical end-users    You possess excellent communication skills and comfort interfacing with people with a wide variety of technical backgrounds and skillsets including:   Infrastructure/DevOps engineers, software developers, report developers, data scientists/statisticians, DBAs/data engineers, security experts, product, project managers, business analysts, legal representatives, executives    You have strong knowledge around accessing and manipulating large amounts of data  It's assumed you know SQL, but you should also have a good intuition of network, disk, memory and processor bottlenecks for queries you run  You should also understand how this change when working against distributed systems on HDFS    You have a 4-Year undergraduate degree in a related field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, etc.) or equivalent work experience    It would be an asset if you have:  experience with start-to-finish data science/predictive modelling projects  comfort level with web development and familiarity with front-end development  Ops or DBA experience on teams responsible for production systems  Proficiency in a JVM-based language  Experience with Spark on YARN and Hive (We're on a Cloudera stack)  Cloud development experience (AWS)  A master's degree in a related field  Familiarity with finance or fintech

title: Senior Manager, Philanthropy - Individual Giving
text: Responsible for a minimum 80-100 prospects in portfolio, with a $1,000,000 accountability in major gifts annually (portfolio value to grow annually commensurate with tenure in role).   Oversee portfolio moves management in terms of identification, discovery, cultivation, solicitation and stewardship, working collaboratively with all Foundation departments (Senior Leadership, Philanthropy, Donor Services, Marketing and Communications, Stewardship) to ensure an accountable and unparalleled donor experience.   Manage timely and quality briefing materials, proposals and presentations for personal portfolio donor and prospect meetings, as well as those identified as priority across the organization to achieve annual revenue targets and objectives.   Demonstrate professionalism as an ambassador for WCHF at related events, activities, and meetings and proven experience collaborating with a variety of stakeholders.   Work in partnership with WCH/F leadership in volunteer engagement, grateful patient relationships, proposal approval and development, and stewardship activities.   Maintain up to date, accurate and fulsome donor/prospect profiles and records of contact in NXT and in records database and confidence managing data entry & utilizing reports   Contribute to efficient organizational processes and procedures, as well as bring an approach of innovation and creative thinking.   Manage and mentor a direct report in their major gifts portfolio.   Be foremost, accountable, as a team player by consistently enacting organizational values of respect, caring, integrity and partnership, supported by being authentic and accountable. Kindness and humour are also important aspects for people interested in joining the Foundation team.   Post‐secondary education preferred. Specialization in fundraising or related field an asset   A seasoned fundraiser with a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a fundraising or similar business environment with demonstrated success in major gift fundraising and meeting KPI’s   Emotionally intelligent, excellence in communication skills (verbal and written), interpersonal, and problem solving skills   Demonstrated superior organization, flexibility, and multi‐tasking skills within a team environment   High degree of initiative, highly organized and ability to complete assigned tasks on time, with accuracy and of high quality   Professionalism and patience when communicating with donors and volunteers, colleagues   Proficient keyboarding skills and a demonstrated proficiency in computer applications including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and more   Experience with fundraising database software an asset   Availability to travel within GTA as necessary and work outside of normal business hours on occasion   fundraising or similar business: 5 years (Preferred)

title: Software Developer Intern - TR Labs
text: Build new solutions from the ground up, work like a startup, utilizing the resources of a large enterprise.    Take on two to three projects during the term, with the goal of getting new products into market, building new data sets, and de-risking new customer opportunities in terms of technical viability, data viability, and customer demand.    Some examples of our work includes ranking global energy leaders, evaluating free trade, using data to combatmodern day slavery, forecasting global food supply, and analyzing the transition from gas to electric vehicles.    Learn from Data Scientists in Waterloo and our sister-labs in Boston, London, and Zurich. Pick the brains of PhD’s and Masters grads with experience in big data, statistics, machine learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and data visualization.    Work at Communitech, one of the most amazing workspaces in Waterloo, home to hundreds of startups and dozens of innovation labs from companies like TD, LCBO, Interac, Manulife, and Deloitte. Over 100,000 square feet of open collaborative workspace, no cubes.    Evaluate career opportunities with a technology team that’s hiring rapidly en route to over 1,500 staff in Canada as part of a $100M expansion.    Development skills to rapidly deliver minimum viable products    Well-disciplined in software engineering and software architecture    Focus on writing clean, testable code    Strong experience with programming languages like HTML, JavaScript, Python, Java, or Scala    Strong experience with data systems like DBMS, NoSQL, Elastic Searchor graph databases    Strong experience in full-stack development and web technology    Bonus:  Work experience in Docker, AWS, Azure, or Google cloud  Work experience in Machine Learning libraries  Interest in Information Retrieval research

title: Senior Software Engineer - Web
text: Build innovative consumer experiences, setting standards for code and performance    Ship your first code in days, iterating on features in an agile manner    Decide how to best build web solutions to take advantage of our platform architecture    Get your hands dirty with all sides of the web stack    Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback for growth    Execute on big opportunities, helping Hopper rise to the top of the travel industry    Thrived in web technologies and delivered user experience at scale    The ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table    Experience mentoring and leading people at different stages in their career    Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Backend Engineers, and other highly skilled specialists    A passionate focus on quality, writing testable code that performs and scales    Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options    Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business    100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans    Access to a 401k (Boston) or Retirement Savings Plan (Montreal)    Easy commute with a paid-for public transportation or parking pass    IATA Travel Agent Card for discounts in the travel industry    Fully stocked kitchen with: coffee/tea, beer, bagels and snacks (both healthy and not-healthy)    In Cambridge, work in a historic factory building near Kendall Square; in Montreal, work in an artist’s loft in the Mile End    Team lunches, offsite activities and much more!

title: Technical Analyst II
text: Develop computational approaches to large-scale interpretation of genomic variants and novel visualization approaches to depict these data in support of clinical reporting   Develop automated pipelines for genomic data transformation and annotation   Build/maintain a catalog/inventory of the clinical and genomic datasets generated, to enable high-level browsing by clinicians and researchers   Develop programmatic approaches to link genomic and clinical databases within cBioPortal   Interact with variant interpretation/annotation teams within local clinical diagnostic laboratories to streamline the interface between interpretation and reporting into the medical record   Undergraduate degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a similar discipline   Minimum 3 years of related experience   Knowledge, interest, or experience in molecular biology   Proven development experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL) and familiarity with the fundamental principles of data modelling and management.   Knowledge of multiple computer systems for database development, coding, statistics, visual design, etc.   Significant experience with Shell scripts, JavaScript, Python, Perl or R   Practical experience with version control tools (e.g. git)   Excellent written and verbal communication skills, excellent organization, prioritization skills, computer skills, ability to learn quickly and work independently   Ability to work under pressure and with attention to detail   Ability to perform duties in a professional and courteous manner and produce high quality work while meeting deadlines in accordance with UHN standards

title: Vice President, AI Engineering
text: Scope out and staff for Vector’s cutting-edge AI developments, transfer AI technology to sponsor and partner organizations and operate a leadership class machine learning computing facility;   Execute on and ensure successful completion of projects, AI developments, technology transfers to sponsor and partner organizations, and AI computing facility initiatives on time and within budget;   Effectively build and lead a diverse team of highly skilled technical staff who are engaged and who deliver on commitments to researchers, sponsors, and partners;   Manage a portfolio which includes prototype, platform and infrastructure software development, upskilling developers and researchers on recent open source and proprietary AI system developments, R&D support services for small and large projects with researchers and/or partner professionals, and procurement and operations of large-scale computer clusters with hybrid utilization of cloud computing services;   Act as a trusted and credible spokesperson for Vector, performing public speaking engagements on behalf of Vector on AI technologies, Vector’s accomplishments and directions;   Recognize, capture and develop intellectual property for the benefit of its inventors, Vector resources & partner organizations; and   Perform other technical and leadership functions, as requested by the CEO, which contribute to Vector achieving its vision, mission, and strategic objectives.   The Engineering team at Vector is fully staffed, effective, and successful in fulfilling commitments to our stakeholders   Internal and external clients understand and are proficient achieving conditions and expectations under which the engineering team can be expected to succeed   Budgetary and other commitments are respected and delivered on   Qualitative client feedback on projects assigned by Industry, Academic, Healthcare, and Research leaders at Vector is uniformly positive and reflective of great value provided   Overall allocation of technical resources by portfolio (Academic, Healthcare, Industry, and Research) is appropriate and in line with guidance provided   Vector sponsors renew sponsorship agreements expressing positive feedback on AI projects and teams   You have a PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent field and/or many years of technical leadership in R&D for innovative information technology software firms, and more recently, machine learning applications for AI industry labs   You are a highly effective communicator and relationship manager with demonstrated proficiency in collaborating successfully with diverse stakeholders.   You are familiar with the operations, design, utility and weaknesses in the popular ML/DL/RL systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe, Scikit, Matlab, R and popular analytics systems such as Tableau, Spark and Hadoop, and with popular cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenStack   You have proven experience with open source development, community decision-making, project management, maintenance, and encouraging deployment of large software artifacts, especially ML/DL/RL/AI cutting-edge systems   You have strong direct, if not necessarily recent, programming experience in modern languages such as Python, Rust, Scala, C++ and Linux shell scripts   You have experience in start-ups, especially in the early stages of staffing and organizing a software R&D team from scratch   You have experience in leading, funding or collaborating with academic research projects, graduate student interns, or university sponsored research   You have strong time management and organizational skills   You have experience inventing or commercializing intellectual property   You are comfortable working with a diverse range of clients (e.g., leadership teams, operations staff, graduate students, and external partners), maintaining confidentiality and providing all with a trusted, respectful point of contact   You possess a positive attitude, integrity, a sense of humour, and bring a positive energy and outlook to a not-for-profit corporate culture   You are motivated by continuous learning and the opportunity to make a difference and a real contribution to the AI ecosystem

title: Senior Environmental Scientist - Richmond Hill, Ontario, Canda; Waterloo, Ontario, Canada
Senior Manager, Money Movement - Product
text: Empowered. You will align feature roadmaps with quarterly and yearly goals, along with setting and achieving OKRs (Objectives and Key Results)    Learning constantly. As you get intimately familiar with our customers’ constantly changing needs, and are in touch with the evolution of the industry, you will need to quickly learn and experiment. You’ll also work with other stakeholders to optimize the product plans while factoring in a multitude of evolving constraints (e.g. regulatory, technical, financial, fraud, etc.).    Succeeding strategically. Solve the right problem and have the confidence to stop work on the wrong one. Grow big by starting small and constantly refining the path towards success.    Communicating and sharing openly. Our culture is one of transparency and openness. Collaboration across multiple teams is a key to success.    Rolling up your sleeves. Filling gaps to advance and improve the product and team. This may include designing wireframes for an experience, helping data scientists label data, and analysts interpret the data, and developing presentations to senior leadership.      Competitive compensation package    Excellent medical and dental insurance (and other health benefits)    Superstar product, design, data and engineering leaders    Highly supportive culture and leadership environment      Prior experience in Digital Product Management, building and launching software to consumers.    Grounding in human centered design with a natural empathy for customers - A bias to action and a proven track record of delivering minimum viable products and business models to market at rapid speed.    Strategic and analytical mindset leading to an ability to effectively identify and prioritize opportunities    A high level of intellectual curiosity and comfort with ambiguity.    A fantastic storyteller who is at ease presenting to senior executives.      Bachelor’s Degree    At least 5 years’ experience building and launching B2C products or experiences via web or mobile    At least 5 years of experience applying analytical rigor to support technology investment decisions    Proven people leader with at least 5 years of experience leading multi-disciplinary teams    Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering    MBA or Masters degree    5+ years of experience translating business strategy, analysis and data into consumer facing digital product    5+ years of experience in Agile product management    Experience working with Agile Methodologies    Experience with managing stakeholder expectations, and confidence to advocate for our customers

title: Solution Architect
text: As a Lead Solutions Architect within the Client Services team, you act as trusted advisor, responsible for the technical requirements and end to end solutions integration of Wysdom cognitive services within the client's environment. You will work with one of the most diverse teams of linguists, data scientists, and innovators to deliver the best AI enabled customer experience    Demonstrated experience in client facing roles such as SaaS services or consulting roles, leading a client facing delivery to exceed client expectation and deliver on-time    Own the complete post-sales implementation lifecycle from requirements capture, through implementation, customer acceptance and launch    Take ownership of client deliverables; collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, technical project managers, product owners, and development teams    Oversee testing practices including creation, execution of joint interoperability and customer acceptance test plans while innovating to speed up delivery without impacting quality    Work collaboratively across internal and external teams to drive resolution of any open technical issues    With internal Development / Knowledge Trainers you will drive technology adoption and ticket resolution    Within Client Services you will drive best practices, architectural assessments, and work breakdown    With Sales you will help guide the technical aspects of solution proposals    Lead client meetings, becoming a trusted advisor to decision makers and stakeholders while demonstrating mastery of the technical domain    You specialize in integration, have solid technical experience in professional services and a proven track record of successfully delivering projects    You have deep technical knowledge of modern Web frameworks, RESTFul services, Service Bus, and Microservices architecture    You have experience driving complex enterprise deployments involving multiple vendors    You have excellent client-facing communication skills    You have the ability and willingness for limited travel to customer sites    You are keen about working on a next big thing in a start-up environment    If you are into AI, even better!    Other ways to think of this role:    Professional Services Consultant    Delivery Consultant    Integration Consultant
